pr_body:
### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements:

* [x] Tests for the changes have been added/updated (if possible)
* [ ] Documentation has been updated/added if relevant

### What is the current behavior?
There is no way for users to have a look at their active sessions and terminate any dangling sessions.

### What is the new behavior?
"Manage Sessions" page has been added inside profile page. "Single session" feature has also been added that allows a user to keep only one active session at a time.

![Screen Shot 2023-06-23 at 2 56 44 PM](https://github.com/Submitty/Submitty/assets/123261952/4ce7141e-931f-4e1d-8721-0cc29d36d471)

![Screen Shot 2023-06-23 at 2 57 14 PM](https://github.com/Submitty/Submitty/assets/123261952/c79e2b8c-15c5-4d0e-b0f8-9d96cd11c3df)


  #### Location:
Navigate to "My Profile", "Manage Sessions" button is situated at the bottom of the page.

### Other information?
Closes #8258

In order to enable browser and platform detection, `submitty_install` needs to be run which will setup the cache needed by `browscap-php`.

pr_body:
### What is the current behavior?
1.) Every user with grading access can view unreleased course materials. 
2.) Hiding a course material isn't a strong protection for preventing students from accessing the material as it can be accessed if the course material ID is known which seemingly is a serial number, if last uploaded course material ID is 119 then next is 120.

### What is the new behavior?
1.) A note has been added to make instructors aware that release dates only apply to students.
2.) In order to make sure that instructors don't use "Hide course materials" as an alternative to setting release dates, an information icon has been added which (on hover) gives an explanation for this.

### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements:

* [x] Tests for the changes have been added/updated (if possible)
* [ ] Documentation has been updated/added if relevant

### What is the current behavior?
The edit folder form in course materials doesn't show any properties (sections, release date, hidden from students) as marked. The only way to look for properties that are common throughout the folder is to open edit form of each file separately.

### What is the new behavior?
Common properties are now marked in edit folder form on course materials page. This is a client side oriented solution.

## Video demonstration:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51257141/181287968-1807f23c-ba44-47d6-8f13-57a14bf6aabc.mov

The video shows that common section 2 is shown checked in the edit folder popup, hide materials checkbox is only checked when the property is same for all the files. Release date is not shown as it is not common.

### Other information?
Closes #8201 and fixes #8262
Also, a new implementation of hide course materials warning (#8150) has been introduced, this removes the repetition of same warning message in different templates and increases maintainability.
